Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Based on patient demographics (age, gender) and department, as well as the activity sequence, initial groupings into three cases were hypothesized.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Linked the first 'Register patient' events (events 1, 2, and 3) to distinct patients based on differing ages, genders, and departments, forming three initial cases.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzed subsequent events to link them with the registered cases, e.g., event 4 (Initial triage) and event 5 (Initial triage) were linked to events 1 and 2 due to matching demographics and the nature of triage following registration.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Confirmed temporal coherence between events within each hypothesized case, e.g., registration timestamps followed logically by subsequent activities like triage, lab requests, and consults.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified that the X-ray imaging for 45M (event 7) and lab test for 62F (event 8) aligned well with the expected flows for those cases (ER-related workflows).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Assigned surgical-related activities (event 9, 13, 16, and 18) to the 28M case (Case 3) based on matching patient demographics and logical surgery sequence.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Validated discharge events (15, 17, 18) by mapping them to their preceding activities and confirming alignment with the timestamps and departments.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Observed that all discharge events (15 for 45M, 17 for 62F, and 18 for 28M) corresponded to their respective case flows in a logical manner.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Examined timestamps and sequencing, which supported the grouping but did not add new case assumptions as no additional information was provided.
